title: Blue Vase
description: Using the a color overlay, and combining two shades, Olivia achieved a swirl of vibrant color in this glass vase.

title: Scrap Vase
description: After several failed attempts to work with cane, Olivia had gathered and hoarded a large amount of cane scraps, which she then reworked into this vase

title: Dream Scape Print
description: The same swirl pattern that has become habit in Olivia"s hand, here shown as a print.This series of prints were made from a sudden urge to create, following a printmaking class with Melanie Yazzie.

title: Butterfly reduction print
description: A reintroduction to the reduction print process.

title: Chaffing
description: This still life is meant to show an angry women searching for purpose and meaning in an oppressive world. Chaffing refers to the uncomfortable boundaries that surround her.

title: Striped Cloth
description: A technical exercise of drawing a patterned textile and pushing tones.

title: Remember Me
description: Part of a community project with Edouard Duval-Carri√© at Centre College, people were asked how they remember the civil war. Olivia concentrated on forgotten black women. The terrible reality of black women"s lives are often brushed over in history lessons, and therefore the mistreatment continues.

title: Paper Chihuly
description: A model of the Chihuly chandelier the Red Hornet, which memorized Olivia from a young age, at the local fine arts center.

title: Granny sweater
description: The first thing Olivia ever crocheted was this sweater. Crocheting was a Craft she picked up over quarantine.

title: Sydney
description: Sydney is a crocheted ornament of her sisters dog.
